channel.title: So What's Due? | Measurement/Evaluation in Educational Psychology

item.title: Does it Work and Why Does it Work?
item.description:
• Week 1 Overview

Week 1 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Introduce yourself in Slack under #introduce-yourself Link
Verify your Qualtrics account Link
Complete modules in Data Camp that address the basic elements of R and tidying data. Link
Think about a population to test Link
Create a post apiece about a Sims study and evaluation verses research Link
Review some literature about program evaluations and introductory materials on measurement Link

item.title: The Basics
item.description:
• Week 2 Overview

Week 2 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Complete modules in Data Camp that address more about tidying data and introduces basic statistics in R. Link
Think about a population to test Link
Review aspects of the basics of program evaluation if needed Link
Respond to one of the posts from last week Link
Review some literature on research designs and measurement properties in R Link

item.title: Personality Tests
item.description:
• Week 3 Overview

Week 3 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Complete modules in Data Camp that addresses data wrangling and more basic statistics in R. Link
Create a draft of your instrument Link
Read a few papers on the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator and create a post Link
Read chapters on quantitative data and testing Link
Watch an optional video on the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator Link
Go though an R walkthrough looking at recoding items through the lens of the Big Five personality traits Link

item.title: Conspiracies
item.description:
• Week 4 Overview

Week 4 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Complete a module in Data Camp that addresses regression using R.1 Link
Refine the draft of your instrument Link
Respond to a post on personality tests Link
Read a few papers on conspiracy theories and create a post Link
Read chapters on evalutaion, measurement, and reliability Link
Watch an optional video on assessing and measuring the belief structure of those who believe in conspriacies Link
Take a tour of spurious correlations Link
Go though an R walkthrough introducting the idea of an exploratory factor analysis Link

  1. Even if you have not been introduced to the idea or believe yourself to need a great deal of assistance, the overall idea here is to get a feel for regression and what it can do. We’ll use the general notion of regression to address areas of measurement in the remaining weeks.↩︎

item.title: Nerds
item.description:
• Week 5 Overview

Week 5 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Complete a module in Data Camp that addresses survey design using R. Link
Simulate data and conduct analyses on validity and reliability Link
Review two posted instruments Link
Read a couple papers on nerds1 Link
Read chapters on item analysis and validity Link
Watch an optional video on sampling methods and bias in surveys Link
Go though an R walkthrough addressing how to deal with missing data Link

  1. Yes you read that right↩︎

item.title: Now You Know
item.description:
• Week 6 Overview

Week 6 Overview

eCampus Slack Description Location
Complete a module in Data Camp that addresses survey analysis using R. Link
Submit an elevator pitch, abstract, and a copy of your instrument for your proposal Link
Critique one posting about nerds from last week Link
Read over and complete the course R project task Link
Consider participating in a large-scale personality project Link

Please remember to submit the task by 11:59 PM this Friday.
